result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryce W Moffett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with the victim - J.D.K. - or with the co-defendants listed in the complaint except incidental contact at school only.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, and shall complete any recommended treatment.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall complete 40 hrs of uncompensated community service during the term of probation.
Court authorizes expungement upon successful completion of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryce W Moffett

records.addlTxt: Motion to Modify Judgment of Conviction

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bryce W Moffett in court.  Attorney Mark W Jeranek in court for Bryce W Moffett.  Agreement reached.  Def enters no contest plea.  Court finds def guilty.  Statements from State and counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Def req expungement; Court so orders upon successful completion of probation.
No contact with co-defendants listed on complaint

Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bryce W Moffett in court.  Attorney Mark W Jeranek in court for Bryce W Moffett. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Case is resolved, however, State needs to notify victim.  Court sets $1000 signature bond.  Court enters NG plea on behalf of def.  Court adj.
Plea hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.
